description: From the dream of a “Southern Belgravia” to constantly evolving Park Town estate Conservation Area, tread the steps of James Knowles during Battersea’s railway boom.

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: Designed and built between 1865 and 1904, the Park Town estate encompasses the challenges, opportunities and aspirations of the society of its time.

factsheet.heading: Architecture
paragraphs: The development owes its specificity to the fact that it was built on a single freehold, and designed under the direction of a single architect, James Knowles Junior.

factsheet.heading: Battersea
paragraphs: The development holds a key spot in the history of Battersea, its shape retains traces of the original island of Battersea, scars of radical changes that the area went through and opportunities to the current challenges of South London.

factsheet.heading: Victorian London
paragraphs: Discover the Knowles father and son, prolific architects and key figures of Victorian London through the literature review "the 19th century" they founded, which saw major author's published.

location.address: Battersea Park Station, Battersea Park road

name: James Knowles and the Park Town Estate Walk
